definition: to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
(onom.) whoosh
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

sentences.english: The detective believes the missing gun is the key to the mystery.
sentences.chinese: 那刺探认为那把丢失的枪是侦破这宗疑案的线索。

sentences.english: We want to spy in Jericho.
sentences.chinese: 我们来刺探杰里科城的情报。

sentences.english: In order to gather intelligence, nakamura work with cloud son say I want to resign back to Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 中村功为了刺探情报，跟云子说本人要辞职回东京。

sentences.english: Even handball teams used new software to spy on rivals' tactics.
sentences.chinese: 就连手球队也采用新软件来刺探对手的战术。

sentences.english: The user shall not provide others with convenience to get the above confidential information unless it is permitted by the supplier.
sentences.chinese: 非经供货方准许，不得为他人刺探以上机密提供方便。

sentences.english: Journalists sometimes spy into the affairs of the celebrities.
sentences.chinese: 新闻记者有时候刺探名人的私生活。

sentences.english: She pries too closely into the private life of her friends.
sentences.chinese: 她太爱刺探朋友的私生活了。

definition: to make inquiries/to try to find out/to pry
secret agent/detective
to make discreet inquiries/to scout out
spy
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to investigate/to observe/to scout/to seek out and examine/to explore
to monitor secretly/to spy on
intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
to assassinate
to check/to investigate/to probe (into)
information/intelligence
police spy/secret agent
to examine/to probe/to scout out/to nose around
military intelligence
to find out/to ascertain/to get an idea of
